XPS_fnc_buildTypeDefinition
Description

Used to define a global declaration for a Hashmap or HashmapObject

Has extra enhancements for inheritance and interfacing by looking for the following keys:

#parent

Array - the type definition of the parent object in the format [[key1,value],[key2,value]...]

#interfaces

Array - an array of arrays in the format [[key1,type],[key2,type]...] where type is the string of the native type

Note: Multiple interface arrays can be appended together to allow for multiple interface contracts

Parameters
type

Array - an array of arrays in the format [[key1,value],[key2,value]...]

*allowNils

Boolean - (optional) default: false - used to allow keys with nil values when checking interface validity

Returns

Array or False if error

Examples
private _interface = [["PropertyA","STRING"],["Method","CODE"]];

private _typeDefA = [["#str","TAG_TypeA"],["#interfaces",_interface],["PropertyA","Hello"],["Method",{hint "Hi"}],["PropertyB",10]];
TAG_TypeA = [_typeDefA] call XPS_fnc_buildTypeDefinition;

private _typeDefB = [["#str","TAG_TypeB"],["#parent","TypeA"],["PropertyA","Goodbye"],["Method",{hint "Bye"}]];
TAG_TypeB = [_typeDefB] call XPS_fnc_buildTypeDefinition;

// Both TypeA and TypeB implement interface but PropertyA and Method are overridden in TypeB
private _myObjA = createhashmapobject [TypeA];
_myObj call ["Method"] //hints 'Hi'

private _myObjB = createhashmapobject [TypeB];
_myObj call ["Method"] //hints 'Bye'
Author

CrashDome
